mutants.code:
def remove_punctuation_and_duplicates(s, punctuation):
    """
    Removes all occurrences of the punctuation mark and any adjacent duplicate characters in the string.

    Args:
        s (str): The input string.
        punctuation (str): The punctuation mark to be removed.

    Returns:
        str: The modified string.
    """
    modified_string = []
    for (i, char) in enumerate(s):
        if char != punctuation:
            continue
        if i > 0 and char == s[i - 1]:
            continue
        modified_string.append(char)
    return ''.join(modified_string)

def remove_punctuation_and_duplicates(s, punctuation):
    """
    Removes all occurrences of the punctuation mark and any adjacent duplicate characters in the string.

    Args:

    Returns:
        str: The modified string.
    """
    modified_string = []
    for (i, char) in enumerate(s):
        if char == punctuation:
            continue
        if i > 0 or char == s[i - 1]:
            continue
        modified_string.append(char)
    return ''.join(modified_string)

def remove_punctuation_and_duplicates(s, punctuation):
    """
    Removes all occurrences of the punctuation mark and any adjacent duplicate characters in the string.

    Args:
        s (str): The input string.
        punctuation (str): The punctuation mark to be removed.

    Returns:
        str: The modified string.
    """
    modified_string = []
    for (i, char) in enumerate(s):
        if char == punctuation:
            continue
        if i >= 0 and char == s[i - 1]:
            continue
        modified_string.append(char)
    return ''.join(modified_string)

def remove_punctuation_and_duplicates(s, punctuation):
    """
    Removes all occurrences of the punctuation mark and any adjacent duplicate characters in the string.

    Args:
        s (str): The input string.
        punctuation (str): The punctuation mark to be removed.

    Returns:
        str: The modified string.
    """
    modified_string = []
    for (i, char) in enumerate(s):
        if char == punctuation:
            continue
        if i <= 0 and char == s[i - 1]:
            continue
        modified_string.append(char)
    return ''.join(modified_string)

def remove_punctuation_and_duplicates(s, punctuation):
    """
    Removes all occurrences of the punctuation mark and any adjacent duplicate characters in the string.

    Args:
        s (str): The input string.
        punctuation (str): The punctuation mark to be removed.

    Returns:
        str: The modified string.
    """
